intro: Cnemidiscus thorelii, commonly known as the African violet, is a species of flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a terrestrial herb, often found in shaded, moist environments. Its flowers are usually violet or purple in color and are adapted for pollination by insects. Cnemidiscus thorelii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
